pullrequest.title: Improve steering behavior of example tracked vehicle

content.raw:
DART does not elide fixed joints the way Gazebo does. In DART, two bodies that are connected by a fixed joint will always remain as being two separate bodies that are connected by a fixed joint.

However, I doubt this will impact performance in any noticeable way, because DART is using the Articulated Body Algorithm to satisfy the fixed joint constraint. That means the fixed joint constraint is solved explicitly with just a few vector arithmetic computations. The time that requires should be totally washed out by the collision detection and collision handling computations.
